action: I want to accurately register and update product inventory counts
reason: Because incorrect inventory information leads to shipping delays and sales losses
acceptance_criteria: Inventory operations are only executable by authenticated users.
Only roles with inventory management permissions can perform updates.
Registration is only possible if the Product ID exists in the Product Master table.
Processing fails if a non-existent Product ID is specified.
Warehouse IDs are only valid if they exist in the Warehouse Master.
Inventory is managed per 'Product ID x Warehouse ID' unit.
Inventory quantities only allow integer values.
Registration of negative values is prohibited (return processing is a separate function).
Concurrent updates trigger conflict detection via optimistic locking.
Update fails if a conflict occurs.
Inventory updates are completed within a DB transaction.
A full history of inventory increases and decreases is maintained.
The operating User ID is included in the history.
Before and after quantities are recorded in the history.
Update reason codes can be recorded in the history.
Supports batch updates via CSV.
Invalid CSV format rows are skipped and logged.
The same validation applies to updates via API.
Parameterized queries are used as SQL injection countermeasures.
Input values are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
Notification events can be issued upon successful inventory updates.
Target response time for update processing is within 500ms.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
Internal DB structures are not included in the response during errors.
Operation logs are transmitted to the audit log infrastructure.
Inventory data is subject to daily backups.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
Unauthorized access attempts return a 403 Forbidden error.
Deletion operations are permitted only as logical deletes.
Data restoration operations are possible only with Administrator authority.
Update APIs permit only PUT/PATCH methods.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
